content.text: Shade the required region on each Venn diagram
The first five terms of a sequence are shown below
Find the \(n\)th term of this sequence
Give your answer in standard form
Triangle \(ABC\) has a height of \(8\mathrm{cm}\) and an area of \(42\mathrm{cm}^2\)
George and his friend Jane buy copies of the same book on the internet
George pays \(16.95 and Jane pays £11.99 on a day when the exchange rate is\) 1 = £0.626
Calculate, in dollars, how much more Jane pays
Use your calculator to work out \(\sqrt{65} - 1.7^2\)
Write down all the numbers displayed on your calculator
Write your answer to part (a) correct to 2 significant figures
Joe measures the side of a square correct to 1 decimal place
He calculates the **upper** bound for the area of the square as \(37.8225 \mathrm{cm}^2\)
Work out Joe's measurement for the side of the square
A car, 4.4 metres long, has a fuel tank which holds 65 litres of fuel when full
The fuel tank of a mathematically similar model of the car holds 0.05 litres of fuel when full
Calculate the length of the model car in centimetres
\(A, B, C, D\) and \(E\) are points on a circle
Without using a calculator, work out \(\frac{6}{7} \div 1 \frac{2}{3}\)
Write down all the steps in your working
Carol invests $6250 at a rate of \(2\%\) per year compound interest
Calculate the total amount Carol has after 3 years
Use the quadratic equation formula to solve
Show all your working and give your answers correct to 2 decimal places
The diagram shows the speed-time graph of a train journey between two stations
The train accelerates for 3 minutes, travels at a constant maximum speed of \(40\mathrm{km / h}\), then takes 4 minutes to slow to a stop
Calculate the distance in kilometres between the two stations
On the grid, draw a scatter diagram to show this information
What type of correlation does your scatter diagram show?
Draw a line of best fit on the grid
The owner of a small café records the average air temperature and the number of hot drinks each day for a week
The rectangle \(ABCD\) is a scale drawing of a rectangular football pitch
The scale used is 1 centimetre to represent 8 metres
Construct the locus of points \(40\mathrm{m}\) from \(A\) and inside the rectangle
Using a straight edge and compasses only, construct the perpendicular bisector of \(DB\)
Shade the region on the football pitch which is more than \(40\mathrm{m}\) from \(A\) and nearer to \(D\) than to \(B\)
Find the interval which contains the median height
Calculate an estimate of the mean height
Complete the cumulative frequency table for the information given in the table above
The heights, in metres, of 200 trees in a park are measured

table.html:
Height (h m)2 < h ≤ 66 < h ≤ 1010 < h ≤ 1313 < h ≤ 1717 < h ≤ 1919 < h ≤ 20
Frequency234745383215
